haze.name: Haze
haze.desc: During battle, visibility is reduced to 1D6+8 spaces.

overgrown.name: Overgrown
overgrown.desc: When setting up the table, you must add 1D6+2 individual plant features or 1D3 areas of vegetation.

warzone.name: Warzone
warzone.desc: When setting up the table, you must add 1D3 ruined buildings or craters to the table.

heavily_enforced.name: Heavily Enforced
heavily_enforced.desc: When fighting opponents from the Criminal Elements Encounter Table, the number encountered is reduced by 1.

rampant_crime.name: Rampant Crime
rampant_crime.desc: When fighting opponents from the Criminal Elements encounter list, add 1 to the number encountered.

imminent_invasion.name: Imminent Invasion
imminent_invasion.desc: Add +2 to all Invasion rolls and if the world is invaded, rolls for war progress are at -1.

lacks_starship_facilities.name: Lacks Starship Facilities
lacks_starship_facilities.desc: You cannot spend more than 3 credits per campaign turn on starship Repairs.

easy_recruiting.name: Easy Recruiting
easy_recruiting.desc: Add +1 to the roll when Recruiting.

medical_science.name: Medical Science
medical_science.desc: The cost for accelerated medical care is only 3 credits per character.

opportunities.name: Opportunities
opportunities.desc: Add +1 to the roll when searching for Patrons.

booming_economy.name: Booming Economy
booming_economy.desc: When rolling for post-battle credit rewards, any 1 on the dice is rerolled until it shows a score other than 1.

busy_markets.name: Busy Markets
busy_markets.desc: Each campaign turn, you may spend 2 credits once to roll on the Trade Table.

bureaucratic_mess.name: Bureaucratic Mess
bureaucratic_mess.desc: When attempting to leave, you must roll 2D6. On a 2-4, you are delayed and cannot leave this campaign turn without a bribe equal to the roll in credits.

restricted_education.name: Restricted Education
restricted_education.desc: You must roll 6+ to be approved for Advanced Training on this world.

expensive_education.name: Expensive Education
expensive_education.desc: The fee to enroll in Advanced Training is 3 credits.

travel_restricted.name: Travel Restricted
travel_restricted.desc: No more than one crew member may take the Explore option each campaign turn.

gloom.name: Gloom
gloom.desc: In battle, maximum visibility is restricted to 9”. Characters that fire can be fired upon at any range, however.

bot_manufacturing.name: Bot Manufacturing
bot_manufacturing.desc: All Bot upgrades are 1 credit cheaper.

fuel_refinery.name: Fuel Refinery
fuel_refinery.desc: Traveling from this world costs only 3 credits.

alien_species_restricted.name: Alien Species Restricted
alien_species_restricted.desc: A random alien species cannot be hired here and cannot undertake any crew jobs.

weapon_licensing.name: Weapon Licensing
weapon_licensing.desc: Any weapon obtained through the Trade Table or purchased outright costs +1 credit.

military_outpost.name: Military Outpost
military_outpost.desc: Add +2 to Invasion rolls. Add +2 when checking for war progress.

dangerous.name: Dangerous
dangerous.desc: When rolling on the Roving Threats Encounter Table, increase the number of opponents by +1.

shipyards.name: Shipyards
shipyards.desc: The cost of all Ship Components is reduced by 2 credits.

barren.name: Barren
barren.desc: No plant features can be used on the battlefield.

vendetta_system.name: Vendetta System
vendetta_system.desc: Opponents become your Rivals on a roll of 1 or 2.

free_trade_zone.name: Free Trade Zone
free_trade_zone.desc: One crew member per campaign turn can roll twice when using the Trade Table, and choose either result.

corporate_state.name: Corporate State
corporate_state.desc: +2 when rolling to find a Patron. Patrons are always Corporations. Failing a mission means being blacklisted.

adventurous_population.name: Adventurous Population
adventurous_population.desc: When successfully Recruiting, you may roll up one additional character and then choose who to hire.

frozen.name: Frozen
frozen.desc: Characters making a Dash may slide. They move 1D6" in a straight line. Collisions cause Stun.

flat.name: Flat
flat.desc: Do not place any hills or raised ground on the battlefield.

fuel_shortage.name: Fuel Shortage
fuel_shortage.desc: The cost to travel from this world is raised by 1D3 credits.

reflective_dust.name: Reflective Dust
reflective_dust.desc: All Laser, Beam, or Blast weapons are -1 to Hit at ranges exceeding 9".

high_cost.name: High Cost of Living
high_cost.desc: Your crew size counts as being 2 higher for the purpose of Upkeep costs.

interdiction.name: Interdiction
interdiction.desc: You are only approved to stay for 1D3 campaign turns. To extend your stay, you must obtain a license (2D6, 8+).

null_zone.name: Null Zone
null_zone.desc: No teleportation device of any type works.

fog.name: Fog
fog.desc: All shots beyond 8" are -1 to Hit.

bureaucratic_mess.title: Departure Delayed
bureaucratic_mess.desc: Your departure has been delayed by a bureaucratic mess. You can either pay a bribe of {bribe} credits to get your flight clearance now, or wait until the next turn.

asteroids.title: Asteroids!
asteroids.desc: Rocky debris everywhere, maybe from a recent collision? You can try to chart a safe path around, or risk going through.
asteroids.avoid_fail_desc: The attempt to go around the field failed (Roll: {roll}). You can use your Probe Launcher for another attempt, or you'll have to fly through.
asteroids.reroll_fail_desc: Even with the probe, no safe path could be found (Roll: {roll}). You must now fly through.
asteroids.savvy_prompt: Select a crew member to navigate the asteroid field for check {current}/{total} (4+ on 1D6+Savvy to succeed).

navigation_trouble.title: Navigation Trouble
navigation_trouble.desc: Is this place even on the star maps? You lose 1 story point as you drift through empty space. Your journey continues...

raided.title: Raided!
raided.desc: Your vessel has caught the eye of some local raiders. You can try to intimidate them with a show of force, or prepare for a fight.
raided.selectCrewPrompt: Select a crew member to make an intimidation attempt (1D6 + Savvy vs 6+).

deep_space_wreckage.title: Deep Space Wreckage
deep_space_wreckage.desc: You find an old wreck drifting through empty space. Scanning it, you get 2 rolls on the Gear Subtable. Both items are damaged and need to be Repaired.

drive_trouble.title: Drive Trouble
drive_trouble.desc: It’s not supposed to make that sound. Three crew members must attempt to fix it (6+ on 1D6+Savvy). Each failure grounds you on the next world for one turn.
drive_trouble.selectCrewPrompt: Select exactly 3 crew members to attempt repairs.

down_time.title: Down-time
down_time.desc: It’s a long time to just sit here. A crew member of choice gains +1 XP, and you can repair 1 damaged item automatically.
down_time.selectCrewPrompt: Select a crew member to gain +1 XP:
down_time.selectItemPrompt: Select a damaged item to repair:

distress_call.title: Distress Call
distress_call.desc: 'This is Licensed Trader Cyberwolf'. Do you come to their aid?
distress_call.selectCrewPrompt: You arrive in time to help save the ship from a drive malfunction. Select a crew member to lead the repair efforts (3 attempts, 1D6+Savvy vs 7+).

patrol_ship.title: Patrol Ship
patrol_ship.desc: A Unity patrol vessel hails you and performs a contraband check. {count} item(s) are confiscated. The next world you visit cannot be Invaded.
patrol_ship.select_items_prompt: Select {count} item(s) to surrender to the patrol.

cosmic_phenomenon.title: Cosmic Phenomenon
cosmic_phenomenon.desc: A crew member sees a strange manifestation in space. They add +1 Luck. If you have a Precursor, you also add +1 story point.

escape_pod.title: Escape Pod
escape_pod.desc: You find an escape pod drifting through space. Do you rescue the occupant?

escape_pod_criminal.title: Rescued Criminal
escape_pod_criminal.desc: The person you rescued is a wanted criminal. They offer you a favor if you let them go. What do you do?

escape_pod_reward.title: Grateful Survivor
escape_pod_reward.desc: The survivor is incredibly grateful for the rescue and offers you a reward of {credits} credits and a useful item.

escape_pod_info.title: In the Know
escape_pod_info.desc: The survivor has nothing to offer but some interesting information. You gain a Quest Rumor and 1 Story Point.

escape_pod_recruit.title: Potential Recruit
escape_pod_recruit.desc: The survivor is a capable individual looking for work. Do you want to hire them?

escape_pod_recruit_full.title: Crew Full
escape_pod_recruit_full.desc: You found a potential recruit, but your crew is already full.

escape_pod_empty.title: Empty Pod
escape_pod_empty.desc: You open the pod to find it empty, save for some drifting dust.

accident.title: Accident
accident.desc: A crew member gets injured while doing routine maintenance. They must rest for one turn, and one item they carry is damaged.

travel_time.title: Travel-time
travel_time.desc: Local conditions force you to take the scenic route. Any injured crew may rest for one campaign turn.

uneventful_trip.title: Uneventful Trip
uneventful_trip.desc: A lot of time playing cards and cleaning guns. You can repair one damaged item.
uneventful_trip.select_item_prompt: Select a damaged item to repair:
uneventful_trip.no_damaged_items: All gear is in working order. The journey continues.

time_to_reflect.title: Time to Reflect
time_to_reflect.desc: How is the story unfolding? What did it all mean? You gain +1 story point.

time_to_read_a_book.title: Time to Read a Book
time_to_read_a_book.desc: There’s time to sit, have a read, and maybe even indulge in a bit of education. Random crew members gain some XP.

locked_in_library.title: Locked in the Library Data
locked_in_library.desc: Pouring over old records and fragments of data, the captain has unearthed some intriguing information about the sector of space you are heading into. You can choose your destination from three generated worlds.

choose_destination.title: Choose Destination
choose_destination.desc: Your ship's database has provided multiple potential destinations. Choose which system to travel to.
